intro: Gochnatia recticulifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf gochnatia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish to brownish flowers arranged in compact clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and often have a distinctive, reticulate venation pattern. Gochnatia recticulifolia is adapted to withstand drought and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
